alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"Like every other prize, it is flawed and subjective. By reifying it, we overinflate the egos of those who receive it, and we undermine those who do not. 'Ultimately, it’s up to us to dethrone the Nobel Prizes,' wrote science writer Matthew Francis last year. 'They rule our perception of science and how it’s done by our consent, and it’s past time we withdrew that consent.'"
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Trouble with the Nobel Prize - Part 2
